org.simplity.service

Class ServiceContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simplity.kernel.data.CommonData
      • org.simplity.service.ServiceContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommonDataInterface, FieldsInterface

    public class ServiceContext
extends CommonData
    Context is created for an execution of a service. A service execution requires a number of actions to be performed. However, each action is on its own, and does not assume presence of any other action. Of course, it expects that certain data is available, and it's job may be to extract some more data. We use a common (we can call this global for the service) data context for all such action. While a DataScape is good enough data structure, we would like to make use this concept for other design aspects, like accumulating messages and tracking error states etc.. Hence this class extends DataScape.
    Author:
    simplity.org

    • Method Detail

      • addValidationMessage

        public MessageType addValidationMessage(String messageName,
                                        String referredField,
                                        String otherReferredField,
                                        String referredTable,
                                        int rowNumber,
                                        String... params)
        add a message that is associated with a data element in the input data
        Parameters:
        messageName -
        referredField - if this is about a specific field, so that client can associate this message with a field/column
        otherReferredField - if the message has more than one referred field, like from-to validation failed
        referredTable - if the referred field is actually a column in a table
        rowNumber - if table is referred, 1 based.
        params - if the message is parameterised, provide values for those parameters. $name means name is a field, and the field value is to be taken from context
        Returns:
        type of message that got added
